poem:
Snow Warning

An amber alert unfurls across the map,  
where snow whispers soft threats  
to the somnolent southwest.  
Fields brace under the cold's swift sweep,  
hedgerows huddle in thin coats,  
and in villages, chimneys exhale  
plumes of warm breath—a testament  
to the quiet persistence  
of hearths against the chill.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
